AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: kelp farmer
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDescription: [PAWN_nameDef] was in charge of one of the many kelp forests surrounding Pyandonea. Kelp was pretty easy to grow, and [PAWN_nameDef] didn't really need to do anything except keep an eye on it. However, harvesting it was an entirely different matter.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: coral grower
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDescription: [PAWN_nameDef] grew for exotic species of coral for a living. There were so many different colours, and shapes, and [PAWN_nameDef] cared for each one equally.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: outpost lumberer
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDescription: Good quality wood was somewhat in demand in Pyandonea, and one of the closest places to get it just happened to be Valenwood. So [PAWN_nameDef], and many others, set up logging outposts in Valenwood. quite the risky decision, as Bosmer are quite fond of their trees. Unsurprisingly, [PAWN_possessive] time there didn't last very long, as they were quickly driven back to Pyandonea by the Bosmer.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: alchemist
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDescription: [PAWN_nameDef] had extensive knowledge of the plants that grow on Pyandonea, and their alchemical uses. While this knowledge could have been used for certain nefarious purposes, [PAWN_nameDef] was mostly interested in providing aid wherever possible.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: alchemical researcher
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDescription: [PAWN_nameDef] was always eager to explore the alchemichal properties of the plant life found on Pyandonea. [PAWN_nameDef] discovered a few interesting things, such as what plants could cure a sore stomach, and what ones would cause one.

AlienRace.BackstoryDef.title: Thrassian coral cultivator
AlienRace.BackstoryDef.baseDescription: [PAWN_nameDef] managed to obtain a truly rare species of coral, one that could only be found on the Thrassian Archipelago. [PAWN_nameDef] treasured that little coral, as if it were [PAWN_possessive] own child. But it never managed to grow very large, likely because it longed for its homeland.
